A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I've seen TLJ twice now. After and during the first showing\, I felt disappointed/let down. I tried to go into the second showing a little more open-minded and with less expectations. It helped some\, and I let some things go / not bother me as much. But I took notes of all the things I liked\, all the things I disliked\, and all the things I had conflicted feelings toward. I think I ended up with 36 things I liked\, 35 things I didn't like\, and a dozen things I still am not sure how I feel. The fact that the negative almost outweighed the positive should speak enough in itself. I admit\, I went into this movie with alot of expectations.. as we all did.. as we all SHOULD. But boy was I let down. I can't actually believe I'm rating this less than 3 stars\, but if I did anything else I'd be lying to myself. Theres some really good things\, but theres some really bad things\, and I don't understand how you can have so many bad things when you know what the fans want. Was it a bad movie? Of course not. Was it a bad Star Wars movie? Its difficult for me to admit\, but kind of\, yes.
